website_summaries.verdict: This handheld charging station lets you keep playing while offering a comfortable grip for both Joy-Cons.
pros: If you never want to be interrupted by dead Joy-Cons again, this charging grip is your best option
The base charges with an included USB-C cable, then connects to your Joy-Cons for a comfortable grip
cons: The included charging cable is only 2 feet long, so you'll need a longer cable to play while charging
More expensive than most charging stations

customer_reviews.title: Really useful!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a bit pricey but it is definitely worth the investment if you have your Switch hooked up to a TV. It is also great to hold a second set of Joy-cons to play with friends. In my case it is particularly helpful since the Switch is not in an easy to access place and I play for extended periods of time so recharging the controllers by connecting to the console is not as practical. If you buy this, take into account that it comes with the USB-C cable to charge the controller but not with a converter to plug into the wall!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Charges joycon while you play
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I recently purchased a second set of joycon and needed a way to charge them. I enjoyed using the grip that came with the switch so even though there are cheaper joycon chargers, I thought this would work better for me since you can charge and play. (I do own a pro controller but I have pretty small hands due to being a girl so the small joycon buttons and placement are pretty perfect for me) Overall I really like this purchase and the only difference I can see from this grip and the one that came with the system is that the handles are slightly see through.
customer_reviews.author: C.A.

customer_reviews.title: good but a little pricey for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a 4, but really nintendo, i know you need to make money, but this should have come with the system. The grip is exactly like the one in the system except it has a usb connector right at the top, not sure why it's at the top and not the bottom? But anyways, it looks cool, translucent gray or smoked plastic look handles. Your joycons just plug in just like the non charge one. It also comes with a usb cable and i guess you just plug it into one of the usb ports on the system. So basically should cost a few more bucks to put the usb connector and some wires
customer_reviews.author: MalekoTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says.
customer_reviews.text: If you've tried the included grip, you know exactly what you're getting here, except that the plastic is semi-translucent (but dark). Only other difference it the USB-C connection to plug this into a USB port to charge it. It comes with a nice Nintendo-branded USB-C cable which you could also use to charge the Switch itself with USB power. Can't dock it any stars because it came in a nice simple package. If anything though, this should be what comes standard with the Switch so you can charge controllers without needing to dock them into the Switch. You can charge and play so it's a no-brainer if you like using the grip but don't want to stop playing to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Lino

customer_reviews.title: Can remove handgrip to accommodate NES classic controllers!
customer_reviews.text: I have those Switch NES classic controllers for playing old school NES games which can only charge in the Switch. This handgrip controller can easily be modified to fit the NES classic controllers. Just need a tri-point (with 3 wings like a Mercedes symbol instead of the 4 wings of a Phillips screw) and Phillips screwdriver. I used the iFixit kit which has both. I've included pics of the steps but it's really fairly obvious. Just remove a bunch of screws in a stepwise fashion, remove the handgrip and then use four of screws to close/secure the case.
customer_reviews.author: Impetigo

customer_reviews.title: The charging grip is a must have accessory for any ...
customer_reviews.text: The charging grip is a must have accessory for any Switch owner. This allows you to play Zelda or Mario Kart without having to worry about constantly putting your joy-cons back in the Switch to charge, just plug it in near you. This also allows you to charge up an extra set of controllers!
customer_reviews.author: Gurney

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: It feels just like the grip included with the console and it comes with a USB-A to USB-C charging cable. I have tested the changing functionality, but have honestly never needed to use it during gaming sessions. I have 2 pair of JoyCons. One pair stays connected to the Switch and the 2nd pair stays in a charging station with my Pro controller when not in use. I bought it because I figured I should be able to charge while playing "just in case".
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent way to keep a Switch controller charged
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee has been playing the heck of Zelda, but the Switch controllers die too often for her liking. I looked at buying a second controller set, but since she's really the only one who plays the Switch I felt that the $70+ price tag for a second controller was too much to spend... then I found this! We already have a USB-C cable by the couch so that we can keep phones/tablets charged, so I just use that instead of the included cable. I'm very happy with this purchase, since it saved me about $50 compared to a second controller and still gets the end result of letting her play Zelda for as long as she wants!
customer_reviews.author: ND Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $$
customer_reviews.text: It's not that much more to get this than it is to get the third party controller grip, and after reading multiple reviews about issues with the joy cons getting stuck or not sliding in correctly I knew I'd rather avoid that headache. There's not much more to say about this product, honestly. Joycons go in perfectly, it can charge an extra pair whether you're using them or not, and I feel comfortable knowing that my extra joycons are in an actual Nintendo product. Get these!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already

Simply leave the joy-cons in the controller and plug the USB C cord in the top of the controller and into the docking station and the joy-cons will charge. My son and his friend played Smash brothers all day yesterday using this controller and the grip controller that comes with the switch console. They liked the controllers way better than trying to play the game on a single joy-con.

customer_reviews.title: Keep playing all night long...

I'm really bad at remembering to charge both sets of joy cons, which means two player sometimes means I don't have a charged set for both of us to play. This prevents that from being a problem. Now I can just connect to power and keep playing with or without friends. It's a great options when you just want to keep playing. Great option to keep your smash on.
